isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - TRUCK BODY CONNECTION

svcproc.title: TRUCK BODY CONNECTION
svcproc.para: The truck body junction block, located at the rear of the cab, provides a ground at terminal 1, marker light voltage from the marker light relay (463-R8) at terminal 2, and battery voltage from Trailer Auxiliary Switch and 15A fuse F10-A at terminal 3.
Terminal 1 of the Truck Body Junction Block is grounded through circuit 11-GM to Trailer Socket Ground inside the cab, 11-GN and 11-GI to Ground Stud at left dash panel.

Turning the headlights to Park or ON energizes the Trailer Marker Lights Relay. This delivers battery power from B2 stud through circuit 14H, 14E, fuse F3-A, circuit 58D, relay (463-R8), circuit 58R, and 58S to terminal 2 of the Truck Body Junction Block.

With Ignition Key ON or in accessory position and Trailer Auxiliary Switch ON, power flows from A1 through circuit 12B, fuse F10-A, circuit 72A, Trailer Auxiliary Switch (418), circuit 72B, and 72A to terminal 3 of the Truck Body Junction Block.
